intro: Ilex puberula, commonly known as the silky holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in Georgia, Florida, and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by red berries in the fall. Ilex puberula is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
